reasons_to_visit.details: Witness Geneva's parks (Parc La Grange, Parc des Eaux-Vives, Jardin Anglais, Botanical Gardens) burst into color with tulips, cherry blossoms, and magnolias.
Enjoy milder weather perfect for exploring the Old Town (Vieille Ville), strolling along Lake Geneva (Lac Léman), visiting Carouge, or seeing the Jet d'Eau.
Benefit from potentially fewer crowds at museums (Art & History, Red Cross) and attractions compared to peak summer. Accommodation might offer slightly better rates (outside Easter).
Lake Geneva boat companies (CGN, Mouettes Genevoises) typically resume more frequent spring/summer schedules, offering scenic cruises and transport across the lake.
Trails on nearby Mont Salève become more accessible for hiking as snow recedes, offering stunning panoramic views of Geneva and the Alps.
Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of markets like Plainpalais or Carouge, and relax at outdoor cafe terraces as they open for the season.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: April can bring variable weather: sunshine, rain showers ('giboulées de mars'), and wind are all common. Temperatures can fluctuate significantly during the day.
While milder than winter, average highs are around 15°C, and nights remain cool (around 5°C). Packing layers is essential.
If Easter falls in April, expect closures or reduced hours for shops and some services on public holidays (Good Friday, Easter Sunday/Monday). Attractions usually remain open but verify timings.
While typically operating from spring, the Jet d'Eau's operation can be affected by strong winds or maintenance. Check daily status if it's a must-see.
Spring blooms mean pollen (especially birch) is high, potentially affecting allergy sufferers.

While Salève becomes accessible, higher Alpine destinations easily reachable from Geneva (like Chamonix/Mont Blanc region) will still have winter conditions. Some high mountain cable cars may be closed for maintenance before summer.

weather.precipitation: Variable; mix of sun, cloud, and frequent rain showers possible. Snow in the city is rare but not impossible.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: T-shirts, sweaters/fleeces, a waterproof/windproof jacket, comfortable walking shoes (water-resistant). Umbrella is essential. Sunglasses for sunny spells.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate. Shoulder season, generally less crowded than summer but increases significantly if Easter falls during this period.
tourism_level.pricing: Mid-range. Accommodation might be slightly cheaper than peak summer, but Easter can cause price spikes.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: City awakening to spring. Parks greening up, early flowers blooming. Outdoor cafe terraces begin opening, often with blankets.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (Pâques)
events_holidays.description: Includes Good Friday (Vendredi Saint), Easter Sunday (Dimanche de Pâques), and Easter Monday (Lundi de Pâques - often a holiday in Vaud but variable in Geneva). Religious significance and family focus.
events_holidays.notes: Shops largely closed on public holidays. Restaurants/cafes mostly open. Check specific attraction opening times. Chocolate shops feature Easter specialties.

events_holidays.name: Geneva International Motor Show (GIMS)
events_holidays.date: If scheduled, often early March/April (check status)
events_holidays.description: Major international car show at Palexpo.
events_holidays.notes: Check official GIMS website for confirmation and dates as the event schedule has varied.

events_holidays.name: Start of Tulip Festival in Morges
events_holidays.description: Though in Morges (nearby town), the stunning tulip displays begin in Parc de l'Indépendance.
events_holidays.notes: Worth a short train trip for flower lovers.

unique_experiences.where: Left Bank, around St. Pierre Cathedral
unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic cobblestone streets, visit St. Pierre Cathedral (climb towers for views), relax on Place du Bourg-de-Four, see Maison Tavel.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for hills/cobblestones. Allow 2-3 hours. Quieter early morning.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the moving history of humanitarian action at the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Museum.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow 2 hours. Accessible by bus. Consider combining with a walk past Palais des Nations.

unique_experiences.where: Quai du Mont-Blanc, Quai Wilson, Jardin Anglais, Quai Gustave-Ador
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy bracing walks along the lakefront, see the Flower Clock (L'horloge fleurie), look for the Jet d'Eau (check if operating), admire views.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Flat and easy walk. Many benches and viewpoints. Cafes nearby.

unique_experiences.description: Discover Geneva's 'Italian' district with its unique architecture, artisan boutiques, cafes, and relaxed atmosphere. Visit Place du Marché.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Take tram 12 or 18. Allow a few hours to wander and browse shops. Great for coffee/lunch.

weather.precipitation: Still variable, increasing chance of warmer days but rain remains common. 'April showers' can be sudden.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering; waterproof outer layer crucial. Sun protection needed for sunny days. Be prepared for quick weather changes.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate. Shoulder season continues, generally pleasant.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Full spring bloom in parks. More activity along the lake. Outdoor dining becomes more common. General feeling of the city opening up for warmer months.

events_holidays.name: Peak Tulip Bloom (Morges)
events_holidays.description: The Tulip Festival in nearby Morges usually reaches peak bloom during this period.
events_holidays.notes: Ideal time for a day trip if interested in the festival.

events_holidays.name: Start of more frequent Lake Cruises
events_holidays.description: CGN boat company often transitions to more frequent schedules for lake cruises and transport.
events_holidays.notes: Check CGN website for updated timetables.

unique_experiences.where: Depart from Mont-Blanc pier or Jardin Anglais
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a scenic boat trip on Lac Léman. Options include short 'Mouettes' shuttle crossings, one-hour 'Mermaid Cruise', or longer trips towards Lausanne/Montreux or Yvoire (France).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check CGN or Mouettes schedules. Dress warmly (windy on deck). Great views of city, Jura, Alps.

unique_experiences.description: Take a bus (e.g., No. 8 to Veyrier-Douane) then the cable car ('Téléphérique du Salève') up for stunning panoramic views of Geneva, the lake, Jura, and Mont Blanc massif.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check cable car operating status/hours (may have maintenance closures). Bring passport (crossing border). Trails available at top (check conditions).

unique_experiences.description: Explore these large, beautiful lakeside parks. See the rose garden (may start blooming late April), enjoy lake views, ancient trees, and maybe catch early outdoor events.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Combine with a walk along Quai Gustave-Ador. Good spot for picnics.

unique_experiences.description: Browse the large flea market (Wed/Sat/Sun - check days) or the produce/food market (Tue/Fri/Sun). Experience a lively local gathering spot.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Best atmosphere on market days. Wear comfortable shoes. Bring cash for market purchases.
